data.name: Doll's Eye
data.description: Doll's Eye Cascadian Dark Ale is a hoppy dark ale with pleasant notes of malt roastiness. Brewed with generous amounts of Cascade and Nugget hops, giving it a piney and floral hop character.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Conshohocken Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Conshohocken Brewing Company is founded on the same American industrial spirit as the borough for which our brewery is named.

Conshohocken was an industrial national hub in the late 1800s – a time of bowler hats, small local breweries and velocipede bicycles. We are carrying that same spirit forward through our hand crafted beers and our personal commitment to each and every beer we brew.

Brewing in small batches, each of our beers is uniquely crafted, allowing us to share innovative, fresh, high quality beers with the good people of our communities. In addition to making beer we love, we have big plans to give back to the community and create a socially responsible brewery.

We look forward to raising our glasses with all of our neighbors and friends, both near and far.

data.name: Duck Pond Nut Brown Ale
data.description: Duck Pond Nut Brown Ale pours a deep ruddy brown with a creamy off-white head. Dark brown, but not black. Toasty and nutty characters persist through the entire glass and call for another glass.

breweries.name: Jack Pine Brewery
breweries.description:
Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.

So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.

Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?

This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.

So, stop in and give it a try!

breweries.name: Short's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In April of 2004 we opened the doors to Short’s Brewing Company in the quaint Village of Bellaire.  Beer was the mission, and liberation was the movement.  With a lot of elbow grease, blind ambition and a little luck, the quest to create a community pub in Northwest Lower Michigan began to take shape.  The philosophy was to bring an appreciation of craft beer to the north with product education and creativity.  The process of appreciation through education we call beer liberation.

Today Short’s Brewing Company continues the effort to educate and liberate consumers.  We take pride in our hands on, mom and pop approach and the energy we put into the quality of our beer, food, staff, customers and facilities. We believe in the power of the smallness.   We intend on remaining a smaller, state wide beer distributor and focusing our energies close to home (the SBC Michigan stimulus package).  Our goal is to get to a comfortable production volume, enjoy what we do and love life in Northern Michigan.

breweries.name: Traffic Jam and Snug
breweries.description: The Traffic Jam and Snug, established 1965, is truly one of Detroit's hidden treasures. Known throughout Midtown for our in-house bakery, microbrewery, and dairy, our curiously intimate multi-level dining rooms, and an eclectic menu of made-from-scratch dishes, there is simply nothing quite like The Traffic Jam.

data.name: English Mild
data.description: A robust yet sessionable English style brew that falls in the line of a dark brown or a light porter. Packed full of notes of toasted nuts, toffee and caramel this brew will surprise most with its big flavor out put and extreme drinkability.

breweries.name: Chain Reaction Brewing Company
breweries.description: With every action there is a reaction. For us a strong foundation of dedication to trades such as mechanics, ironwork and carpentry was laid early in life. With the love of these trades the need to create was always a must and that is what brings us to this point of wanting to share our beers with the public. We never focus on pleasing just one style since we love just about all of them and while not every beer we brew will be the perfect student in its category it will be one that will get the craft beer loving palate craving more with each sip.

breweries.name: Four Corners Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The story of Four Corners Brewing Co. is simple. We’re Dallas natives and we’re craft beer fans. Most importantly, we are a dedicated team of brewers with the goal of offering handcrafted beers that pair well with the food, music, art and culture in our hometown. Refreshing and soulful, it’s what we call “local flavor” and we proudly raise a glass to that! 

Flavorful and satisfying 
“All Day” Ales…that’s what we’re brewing.

breweries.name: Roaring Fork Beer Company
breweries.description:
Roaring Fork Beer Company was launched in 2013 by Chase Engel, a long time professional brewer with a dream of producing creative beers to match the changing seasons. From our home base in Carbondale, Colorado we brew and package exceptional beers for distribution throughout the Roaring Fork Valley. We are dedicated to producing fresh, approachable, and flavorful beers, while continuing to push the envelope with experimentation and barrel aging on a small batch scale.
 
Tasting Room Open M-Sat 2p-8p with brewery tours by appt.

breweries.name: The Sprig & Fern Brewery
breweries.description:
In brewing, as in many things in life, what you put in effects what comes out. Our brewing philosophy is simple - we use quality ingredients and work very hard to ensure quality and consistency. We source our hops and cider apples locally, and our malts from suppliers in both the South and North Islands. Our specialty malts that provide the colour and flavour for some of our different beer styles are sourced from South Canterbury, Germany and the United Kingdom. We use the local town supply water, which is extremely good quality for our beer and cider production.

Our beers and ciders are produced using all natural ingredients and are unpasteurised to retain their full flavour. We call it 'Real Live Beer' and encourage you to keep it well refrigerated to maintain quality and freshness.

breweries.name: Fort Garry Brewing Company Ltd.
breweries.description:
FORT GARRY is Manitoba’s oldest microbrewery. Established in 1930, our recipes and brewing techniques are a time honoured tradition that have been passed down through the generations. Only the finest raw ingredients are used to brew our fine ales and lagers. Our line up of products includes our world-famous Fort Garry Dark, Fort Garry Light, Fort Garry Pale Ale, Fort Garry Rouge and Frontier Pilsner. 

Fort Garry also distributes brands in Manitoba for our sister brewery in British Columbia, Russell Brewing Company. Fort Garry Brewing and Russell Brewing Company are wholly owned subsidiaries of Russell Breweries Inc.

data.name: Foul Weather Jack
data.description: A classic English Mild Ale named for a British Admiral. Every time this 18th century sailor went to sea he went in a doomed ship that sank due to beastly weather. The Foul Weather Jack is a dry, roasty, session beer, with chocolate notes. It is equally satisfying on a hot summer day, or a cold rainy night at sea.

breweries.name: Saint Benjamin Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Saint Benjamin Brewing Company is a nano-brewery operating in Philadelphia, PA. The brewery is located in the historic carriage house and stables of the now defunct Finkenauer Brewery. The quickly growing brewery is known for their reinterpretation of classic styles, and designing new creations such as Inca and Liaison Saison. 

The business was established in 2010, and opened its doors in 2014.

breweries.name: Tired Hands Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We value local over imported, small batches over mass production, and striking a successful balance between giving back to our community and personal profit. Localization guides everything we do, from sourcing raw ingredients and materials, to employing area talent.

Tired Hands Brewing Company will operate at 16 Ardmore Avenue, Ardmore Pa, on a six barrel brewhouse. We will focus our brewing on two very broad styles of beers that hold a special place in my heart: Belgian/French farmhouse ales and American hop-forward ales.

All cheeses, meats, and seasonal produce served at our cafe (simple and satisfying fare from honest local producers) will be sourced from within 100 miles of our brewery.

Welcome to Metazoa Brewing Co. conveniently located near Fountain Square, we are making beer with a cause. We have decided that no less than 5% of our overall profits will go to various animal sanctuaries and foundations.

      All four members of our team are passionate about animals and beer. We hope to make Metazoa Brewing Co. a welcoming and educational place for everyone,  including the novice, expert, and animal lover.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!

data.name: Little London
data.description:
Colorado Springs was founded as a resort in the pristine wilderness. It attracted so many English tourists, many of whom had helped finance the town’s railroad, that it garnered the nickname “Little London”.
In tribute, we present this classic English Mild. It’s most refreshing brown ale, malt-forward with dried fruit aromas that lead to a light body of roasted coffee and walnut. A true session beer to start your retreat.

breweries.name: Pikes Peak Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We established our Monument, Colorado brewery in 2011 as a place for our community to connect and come together. We believe the best beers are ones shared with friends and we hope that wherever you find a Pikes Peak Beer, it finds you in good company.

We would rather brew for our neighbors than notoriety, so our beers are personal expressions that stay faithful to classic styles. We’re lucky to be at the source of some the country’s finest ingredients. From our abundant grains and fresh hops to our pristine waters, we’re inspired by our landscape to make beer as solid and iconic as our namesake mountain.

Since receiving such an overwhelming response, we’ve made it a priority to give back to the community that’s been so good to us. Our seasonal beers support organizations that make our corner of Colorado such a great place to live. At Pikes Peak Brewing Company, we’re elevating the craft of beer and invite you to join us on our trek to the summit.

data.name: Mamoot English Mild
data.description: Mamoot is the brown ale’s laid back brother, a perfect breakfast beer. Subtle notes of jam, coffee, and chocolate add to the toasty finish. This brew is mahogany colored and full flavored, despite the relatively light ABV.
data.foodPairings: Mamoot is great with BBQ, frog legs and beef jerky.  Mamoot and Gouda cheese is a fine afternoon snack.

Beer is meant to be enjoyed with friends and family in a social setting.  We try our best to provide both a great atmosphere for enjoying our craft, as well as an engaging, educational experience to become better acquainted with the Logboat brand. 
Explore…Dream…Discover

breweries.name: Adnams Brewery
breweries.description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.

data.name: Mason's Dark Mild
data.description: One of our extreme session beers, this dark roasty malt-accented beer is our lowest alcohol beer yet. This session ale is toffee and chocolate accented with just enough hops to keep the malt sweetness from getting cloying. Brewed with English malts and English Goldings hops, this classic English-style ale was born for the Pub and your pint glass.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Mad Fox Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mad Fox Brewing Company offers a dining experience unique to the Washington, DC, area: upscale casual dining in an English-style gastro brewpub with an emphasis on high-quality food to complement our house-brewed beers.

Mad Fox features a chef-driven, seasonal menu and frequent specials including pizza, panini, salads and vegetarian friendly foods; fresh, locally grown seasonal produce, cheeses and other ingredients; locally raised lamb, bison, beef, chicken and game; and house-cured meats.

Mad Fox has a 63-foot long bar showcasing our seven to ten standard, house-brewed beers on tap as well as a rotating selection of seasonal brews in German, English, Belgian and American styles. Also, don’t miss our cask conditioned proper Real Ales served through water jacketed Angram beer engines, ensuring that every pint is served at properly conditioned cellar temperatures.

data.name: Meathooks
data.description: Toasty, biscuity and satisfying, lush layers of malt flavor and aroma culminate in a clean dry finish that begs another taste. Meathooks is the perfect companion to great food and excellent conversation. It's like a warm hug from the inside out.

breweries.name: The Post Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
The Post Brewing Company brews beers that are gosh darn delicious, memorable, and something you will want to put in your mouth repeatedly. Bryan Selders, Brewmaster, has purposefully designed these beers to pair perfectly with your meal. The GoodBird Kitchen, run by Chef Brett Smith, serves you delicious comfort food cooked with the love of your grandma and the skill of passionately trained chefs that is meant to be shared like a family supper.

Pull up a chair, order some vittles and get after it!

data.name: Midshipman Mild
data.description: A Dark Mild brewed with mild malt and Kentish Hops leaving a roasted aftertaste on the palate.Mild was originally known as a training beer and this bears relation to the use of the Naval phrase "Midshipman". Meaning A non commissioned officer below the rank of Lieutenant. Usually regarded as being in training to some degree. Was also known as a "Snotty". The lowest form of rank in the Royal Navy where he has authority over and responsibility for more junior ranks, yet at the same time relying on their experience and learning his trade from them.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale

breweries.name: Nelson Brewery
breweries.description:
The brewery was first brought to the Historic Dockyard at Chatham as the Flagship Brewery in 1995 where it established a five barrel kit brewing up to 100 firkins a week. All the ales have nautical themed names to gel with the surroundings in which it is brewed


In 2003 the brewery was bought and renamed the Nelson Brewing Company to fall in line with the most famous naval hero of all time 'Admiral Horatio Nelson' and that his flagship 'The Victory' was built here in Chatham Dockyard.

In July 2006 the brewery was purchased by Piers Macdonald. Piers has over 20 years experience in the brewing industry and is passionate to keep the traditions of Kent brewing alive. Using the best ingredients and the finest Kent hops, combined with the expertise and dedication of his brewing staff, Piers plans to build on the brewery's already growing reputation as the provider of some of the tastiest ales on the market.

Now brewing from a seven and a half barrel kit and regularly having over a dozen ales of various strengths and taste available, the brewery is sure to have a beer to suit all!

breweries.name: Surly Brewing Company
breweries.description:
While you're enjoying the full-bodied flavor of the beer, remember that it was more than 10 years in the making. We think it was worth it. We hope you agree.
 
Surly: The anger fueled by the inability to find good beer.

"We brewed beer for people who didn't know they wanted to drink it until they had it." - Omar Ansari

breweries.name: Brothers Craft Brewing
breweries.description:
Harrisonburg, VA is and always has been our home, so where better to open a brewery than in our own backyard? Well, maybe our taproom/brewing facility isn’t literally in our backyard – in fact we renovated a soda bottling plant to suit all of our production needs – but with such a close-knit and supportive community, every inch of Virginia feels like home.

Brothers Craft Brewing (originally Three Brothers Brewing) was founded by the three Shifflett siblings, who used their collective experience to execute a singular vision: brew exciting, unique craft beers that emphasize and support our community.

It didn’t take long to realize that same community was our extended family. The three of us may be related by blood, but our staff, our customers, and our collaborators have all become brothers.

When thinking about the people we’ve surrounded ourselves with and making sure we had the ability to continue to grow, we made the bold decision to rebrand our business as Brothers Craft Brewing.

Despite the challenges associated with such a change, we feel that our new name truly represents our evolution as a business. Why limit our brotherhood to three when we’ve gained so much family already?

When we started this endeavor, we couldn’t have possibly imagined the growth we’ve been so fortunate to experience. Since beginning production in December of 2012, we’ve had the honor of taking home various awards, expanding our production facilities and distribution, but most importantly we’ve been able to share our passion for meticulously crafted, delicious beer with each of our fans.

So thank you all for everything you’ve done for us. Thank you for keeping our dream alive.

Cheers!

data.name: Mild
data.description: A traditional take on an English Dark Mild, this beer has a mellow, pleasant aroma with a hint of roasted malt. With a very low hop profile, sweet malt flavors are the signature of this smooth, easy drinking, sessionable beer.

breweries.name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.

Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale

breweries.name: Fountain Square Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Back in the Summer of 2011, we got the crazy idea to startup a brewery, not because we wanted to be on the bandwagon, but because we wanted something different, something our talents and passion for beer could make happen. Out technical background in Microbiology, Chemistry, and Automation, made up the perfect storm needed to produce quality beer with a higher level of consistency and with improved shelf stability. Our passion for beer and diversity of tastes allowed us to craft carefully refined recipes that we know will delight you.

We chose Fountain Square because of the community. Since we will be the first to admit our creativity and talents exist on a side of the brain that has little capability to draw, we have this admiration and attraction to those whose talents reside in the arts. We have connected to this community over the past year and look forward to being a vehicle for expressing its artistic nature. Fountain Square is a community of hard working, creative, fun loving, and genuine people. They are probably the most helpful people we've ever met. We are truly honored to be a part of the community and will strive to be worthy ambassadors and stewards.

data.name: Mild At Heart
data.description: ‘Dark Mild’ English style session beer with the ABV and color of an Irish Stout but a nuttier, softer mouthfeel from crystal and chocolate malts, and a finishing dryness from aroma hops. Brewed for drinkability to extract the maximum complexity and flavor from a relatively ‘light’ beer, warm fermented to accentuate dark fruit and roast malt notes. Conceived for cask and perfect served as a Real Ale. Hopped with Cluster and Perle.

breweries.name: Bluegrass Brewing Company
breweries.description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.

breweries.name: Magic Hat Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Saturnalian Saga of Magic Hat began in 1994 when our first batch of beer was brewed in a funky little space on Flynn Avenue, in Burlington, Vermont.  Dozens of beers and a brewery later, the Vermont brewery finds itself reaching more than 30 states with its unique take on classic styles.  Magic Hat continues to be a leader in craft beer and is currently the only craft brewer putting a performance in every bottle.

data.name: Old Peculier
data.description: One of the great beers of the world - rich, dark, smooth and mellow tasting, with a character all its own.  Brewed using the traditional Fuggle hop, Old Peculiar is our best known beer and has a large and enthusiastic following across the globe.

data.name: Organic India Dark Ale
data.description:
Organic India Dark Ale is brewed from barley malt and more aromatic hop types, which gives a fresh scent of hops and citrus. 
English chocolate malt beer is soft, and the rounds dark coloring comes from toasted wheat-and barley malt. Organic India Dark Ale has a nice and creamy foam, and the large amount of new Zealand hops gives a good, fresh bitterness. A beer with nice fill.
data.foodPairings: Organic India Dark Ale is very well suited for the heavy kitchen as oksebov, pig jaws and tasteful sausages, and reflects strong dishes with a pleasant bitterness

breweries.name: Herslev Bryghus
breweries.description:
Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord. 

We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability. 

We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

data.name: Pacific Ocean Blue
data.description: This hop-fueled dark mild, our diminutive take on the popular West Coast hoppy amber style, delivers waves of sticky and juicy hoppiness from Mosaic, Comet, and Citra. We cut back on the alcohol, but kept all the hops and flavor. Farewell my friend Dennis Wilson.

breweries.name: Right Proper Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Right Proper Brewing Company will be a locally owned neighborhood brew pub in a Washington DC neighborhood

Washington, DC, needs at least two things: more affordable neighborhood restaurants, and at least one locally owned brewpub. 
Our objective is three-fold: We want to create a neighborhood gathering place that makes and serves well-priced delicious food and amazing fresh beer; we want to help our neighborhood thrive by investing in the community and its residents; and we want to anchor Washington, DC on the map as a destination for craft beer. Our business will invest in the growth and development of our employees as well as of our community.

We’ll take an innovative approach to small scale, “yeast-forward” craft brewing to produce artisanal ales and lagers in a comfortable, expertly designed casual old-world tavern. Serving fresh beer and affordable, high-quality American food, Right Proper will be a focus of pride for its neighborhood.

Like most brewery adventures, the dream goes back many years and has uncountable iterations. The final version came down to one man finally finding the heart, with a little shove, to drop out of Corporate America and follow what is every brewers dream...opening your own brewery!

data.name: Patrick’s English Mild
data.description: A low gravity session beer that we playfully referred to as our breakfast beer. A dark malty beer with a light but complex flavor, similar in flavor to a brown porter but you can drink it all night without feeling it in the morning. English milds in particular are best served fresh, so if you have tried this style in a bottle and it wasn’t to your likening, give it another shot.

breweries.name: Oak Park Brewing Company
breweries.description: British and Belgian style beers with a West Coast edge. Our full kitchen pairs our beers with local and seasonal ingredients. Cheers!

data.name: Peter's Mild
data.description: Peter’s Mild is brewed to commemorate the life of Peter Austin, founder of the Ringwood Brewery and innovator in the development of modern craft/micro-brewed beer in England. Ruby-tan in color with a fluffy off-white head, this classic English mild ale bears an American influence, with its generous, yet judicious, hop profile. The flavor and aroma hold layers of malt depth, from toasted bread and hazelnut spread to chocolate-covered salted caramel, glossed-over by gently herbal, fruity hops. Our carefully-selected hops and malt conspire to compliment and contrast simultaneously, each slightly out-balancing the other, leaving a sense of intrigue after each sip. Arcadia’s house Ringwood-style yeast brings with it a pleasantly aromatic English influence, with notes of overripe strawberries, dark pie cherries, and exotic stone fruit. All in all, this is an eminently drinkable, “moorish” pint of ale that compels the drinker to dive deeper into its coppery depths, and particularly enjoyable on cask or served “real”.

breweries.name: Arcadia Ales
breweries.description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

data.name: Relaxation
data.description: This English session ale may be light in alcohol, but what it lacks in booze, it more than makes up for in flavor. English Maris Otter is the base of a pyramid which ascends through crystal malts, to the biscuity Victory, and capped with a touch of chocolate. A blend of Willamette and Cascade hops add just enough floral hopiness to keep this from being overly-sweet. The result is a slightly nutty/biscuity, malty beer that is refreshing and low enough in ABV to be able to enjoy a few. Cheers to the English and their session beers!

breweries.name: Grateful Hands Brewing
breweries.description: Grateful Hands Brewing produces small (20 gallon) batches of dark ales, focusing on quality not quantity. We are not a large company and have no desire to become a large company. We desire to stay small, local, and dependable. We always want to keep the creativity and fun involved in making and taking care of our beer so that it is always as enjoyable for you to drink it! We are Grateful to be able to share our beer with you. Cheers!

data.description: This medium bodied brown beer features a smooth malt flavor with hints of chocolate and roast and just enough hops for balance. A popular style in English pubs. The residual sweetness makes this is an easy drinking beer with a full flavor and a lower alcohol content.

breweries.name: Weasel Boy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded by Jay and Lori Wince in 2006 Weasel Boy Brewing Company began brewing operations in July of 2007. The brewpub brews mostly traditional style ales specializing in well balanced session strength offerings. 
Winners of GABF medals in both 2010 (bronze) and 2012 (gold) for their Anastasia Russian Imperial Stout, Weasel Boy is well recognized for brewing high quality products. 
The brewpub offers artisan pizza made with fresh local ingredients, supports local art and music, and regularly participates in community events benefiting local causes.

data.name: Rock Mild
data.description: The mirror image of Rock Bitter, this smooth, dark mild has a biscuity flavour.  Back in the pre-war days this beer would have been on sale in virtually every one of the brewery's jug & bottle counters’ throughout Nottinghamshire, and beyond.

data.description: Fruity full body ale. Full body mouth feel with a bright red colour and fruity hedgerow aromas

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Oast House Brewery
breweries.description:
A small Micro-Brewery based just outside the coastal town of Aberystwyth in Mid Wales, producing cask conditioned and bottled real ale for Aberystwyth, the surrounding area and occasionally further afield.

We are currently Cuckoo Brewing while we save up funds to buy our own kit, but we are looking forward to doing that in the near future.

Oast House Brewery takes its name from the old maltings based in Trefechan. We liked the idea of resurrecting a little of Aberystwyth’s ale past, and so we named ourselves after them. The Old Oast House which can still be found in the harbour was used for drying and roasting barley in order to create malt. We use malt in our ale to give our ale both flavour and sugar. You get to taste the flavour in our ale, but the yeast eats most of the sugars and turns them in to alcohol. We did look into basing our brewery in the Oast House but unfortunately it is not for sale.

available.name: Limited
available.description: Limited availability.

style.name: English-Style Dark Mild Ale
style.description: English dark mild ales range from deep copper to dark brown (often with a red tint) in color. Malt flavor and caramel are part of the flavor and aroma profile while, licorice and roast malt tones may sometimes contribute to the flavor and aroma profile. Body should be low-medium to medium. These beers have very little hop flavor or aroma. Very low diacetyl flavors may be appropriate in this low-alcohol beer. Fruity-ester level is very low.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.
